page.title: 11THE FORGET-ME-NOT CLUB
page.content: {FOR-GET-ME-NOT CLUB This club for over 60's meets once a fortnight on Thursday afternoons in Legbourne Village Hall when they chat over refreshments and play dominoes and cards.One week the schoolchildren sang'Old Tyme'songs to them and asked them their likes and dislikes in 1985. Among the things they liked were modern labour saving inventions like washers, gardens,flowers,open fires, most children,bingo,animals and radio. Some of their favourite T.V.programmes are Crossroads,Emmerdale Farm,Snooker, Dynasty,Wrestling and Benny Hill.They disliked vandals, hooligans,noisy motor bikes,the new Â£1 coin,packet foods,rubbish strewn in the street, discos,cold weather,heavy traffic, motorways and people who grumble.One liked whisky in a cup of tea. ,
